comment: Great guy tbh

He's kinda mid but if you have to take him for easy grade then do it. Found it honestly boring and I feel like I knew more about philosophy from independent reading than from his class. It was an easy grade so not complaining, just wish he was more engaging. Plus the SWA directions were unclear and people had to email him about it. He's just okay.

Weekly discussion post, reflections, a midterm short-essay, and a finals essay. Lectures were okay some were more interesting than others. Not much opportunities/versatility for extra credit. Will ask you follow up questions he has an interest in what his students think. Takes attendance so show up but he's reasonable if absent or late. Good class

Quiz, discussion, and reflection almost weekly. Quizzes are 6-8 q's, disc req is to say something of value + no response requirements, reflections are 15 sentences with one in-text citation and have to be submitted with an AI detector. Midterm and final are 1K words. Prof not friendly but not rude. Extra cred for philosophy meetings. Easy class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Tons and tons of reading. Not really fun philosophy topics, just boring ones. Work is pretty straightforward. Writing post of 15 sentences, discussion, and 7-8 question quizzes. No tests, just 2 writing assignments that are 1000 words.

He is awesome professor he made philosophy bearable. There is a LOT of reading to do. 2 assignments a week both written responses. Attendance is mandatory but accepts last minute excuses as long as you email him. He provides extra credit opportunities and he is well prepared for each lecture.

very easy and nice professor. does have quizzes, which are 8 questions but are easy if prepared. he also does have discussion posts and assignments which are very easy. final and midterms are just short essays that are accessible about a week or 2 before they are due. videos and readings are included in each weeks work

He was a good professor, and class was mandatory the whole semester. If you did not go, you would probably fail the class. He did hybrid Fridays, so you could either do a discussion or go to class. He also did weekly reflections and required a quote from the readings of that week. There were 2 major writing assignments. Overall, interesting class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Fontini was a great guy and professor. He was social and open to getting to know all his students and interacting with them. We had weekly reflections and discussion posts to do. Attendance was important. We only had two major papers to do, which were a final and midterm. overall, great professor and very discussion-based class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Online Savvy

comment:
pros: kind, understanding, clear with grading expectations, not too much assignments, down-to-earth, no textbooks, doesn't randomly call on people

cons: HEAVY attendance (must attend 75% of lectures to pass. 85% to get an A), random reading quizzes

Overall an amazing prof and I would 100% take him again.

Fontini is the best possible philosophy professor. He loves class participation and has a shocking amount of philosophical knowledge. He was always helpful and his lectures were fun and informative every time. 

Only warning is that he is a tough grader. The positive being he wants you to succeed, so ask for help and he will be there to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: This guy rocks. He's so funny, real, and extremely intelligent. There are NO wrong answers in this class, not even in discussion posts or reflections. As long as you actually try, you'll get an A. Attendance was mandatory, but class was never boring.

Very clear course consisting of weekly discussion posts, reflections, and quizzes. If you listen to the lectures and take notes, you will get an easy A. I got a 100 on everything except the two short writing assignments, but those were still low A's. If you do the work you will get an A. Great lectures and wants to see you succeed!

This dude is really relaxed if you take him online. Honestly it is not worth trying to take online because he said they fail all the time compared to his in person. It is about impossible to fail HOWEVER like 80% of your grade will be on attendance but as long as you show up, easy A.
Easy and fun
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took this class online. It was a pretty easy class. He posted lectures for all of the material and talked through everything. There was normally something to read even if it wasn't a textbook. The quizzes went by the material and they weren't too hard. There was a lot of writing, but they weren't too long, difficult, or harshly graded.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Fontini is an amazing professor, if he is still teaching take his class

I took his online philosophy course during the summer. As a visual learner, it was hard because he always provided audio lectures. His quizzes were difficult, each quiz included 4 questions, so if you get one wrong it's a 75%, if you get two wrong it's a 50% and you fail. He also used strange vocabulary that even the computer could not recognize.

He was a good professor and I honestly would take him again. He once said "Your paper is due on Sunday and I did this because technically your break doesn't start until Monday." He threatened reading quizzes but never gave them. Extremely easy grader even if you just write about BS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Fontini was a great professor. He was one of the best if not the best professor I have had so far. I wouldn't take phil2010 if he wasn't my professor.

Most of the quizzes had 4 questions, so obviously if you get one wrong you are already at a B. Also, open-ended short writing assignments were graded tough without a rubric or grading scale provided, and you have to email him to get feedback. Even if you follow directions he will take points off for things that weren't stated.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took him over the summer and overall the class was not great. I thought it would be much better based off the reviews but it was not. The reading was overwhelming with some weekly assignments having over 70 pages to read. I feel like he was also a tough grader. He left no feedback on any assignments. Overall pretty tough
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Fontini is truly one of a kind. His classes are discussion based, but don't let that scare you away. He offers a welcoming environment. I tend to be on the quiet side, but even I enjoyed participating in the conversations. He grades off of short weekly assignments and two short papers (like 5 paragraphs). Please take him!

I took this class over the summer semester, and I enjoyed what we learned each week. Professor Fontini encourages class discussions, and the work overall is not difficult. The class structure is straightforward, just read the provided documents and syllabus. As long as you complete the work and attend class you will be fine.

Bro uses the most complicated words ever. Like you need to use the dictionary just to understand what he is saying. He also gives like no feedback on your work even if you get a bad grade. Quizzes are also lowkey hard and if you get one question wrong you automatically get a B.

Professor Fontini is a very caring and charismatic person. He is very knowledgeable about his material and even knows ways to connect it to common things (science, technology, society) so that students can understand the material better. You should definitely come to class because his discussions and lectures are honestly interesting to listen to!

Do the weekly reflections and go to class, you will finish with an A. I was gonna drop the class at first because i truly didn't understand anything he talked about but he told me "no answer is a wrong answer" and stuff started making sense.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: great prof. engage in class discussion and ask for feedback and he will help you immensely. grades are based on attendance and weekly reflections. there were two papers that he grades pretty hard but ask for help and he is very willing to do so.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Grades are based attendence and a weekly reflection post. If you try you will get an A. Not even a lot of effort. Show up, understand as best you can what he lectures and respond to the reflections. You will have to write an essay for exam grades, but even that is easy. He gives feedback on all assignments. Genuinely cares.

Professor Fontini is an excellent professor and a wonderful person. He is very knowledgeable about what he is teaching and how to keep a class engaged in his lectures. Easy A if you so up to class, plus he cares about all his students and treats them with respect.

Fontini was a fantastic professor! He's reasonable with late work. The one thing he won't work with is people who don't come to class or don't listen to lectures. One of my all-time favorite professors! Grades come from attendance, 2 short writing assignments, and weekly reflections. Take him! (NO QUIZZES OR TESTS)
this class was buttcheeks
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Wonderful professor and human being. Every conversation with Dr. Fontini was a pleasant one. Great lectures, likes when people participate and lead discussions, and makes each student feel valued. If you take him, please participate as much as possible! It will pay off for you when writing your reflections, and he will really appreciate it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: One reflection discussion post on Sunday nights. 2 short writing assignments which were fairly easy. Lengthy readings, but you can read and use outside resource summaries and videos to help understand the material. Though it is very lecture heavy, you'll learn something new every day. He's great! take him!
Cares about what he is teaching and just wants people to be involved. As long as you do the work and show up you will get an A in the class.

Dr. Fontini has made this my most enjoyable class at KSU. I genuinely look forward to this class, his lectures and discussions are great. Typically you will have one discussion post a week and 2 short writing assignments in the semester. He does grade for attendance. Overall such an enjoyable class!!! Definitely take him

Dr. Fontini is a great professor. I was skeptical about taking philosophy, but he is so knowledgeable, funny and makes the class interesting. You have weekly readings which can be long, and there are weekly reflections but they are short and easy. Going to his class is probably my favorite of the day. Overall a great professor and an easy A.
I adore him . So easy . One assignment a week
Very easy to talk to if you dont understand and will try and work around you if you dont get something

Dr. Fontini is a fantastic professor that teaches a great class. His carefree approach to teaching the subject is incredibly refreshing and made the course one of the few I truly looked forward to. The class discussions are always enjoyable and enlightening, so while attendance isn't needed to pass, I'd really recommend you attend anyway.
